intro: Hoarea, commonly known as the African daisy, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to yellow. The plants typically grow in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in full sun. Hoarea species are often used in ornamental gardening due to their hardiness and attractive blooms. They have a compact growth habit and are relatively easy to care for in suitable climates.
